Uses of Class
org.pepstock.charba.client.enums.TimeUnit

  • Packages that use TimeUnit 
    Package Description
    org.pepstock.charba.client.adapters
    Contains all classes to interact with date adapters implemented by CHART.JS to be abstract from date time java script library to use.
    org.pepstock.charba.client.configuration
    Contains all elements to configure a chart instance (know as chart options at instance level).
    org.pepstock.charba.client.defaults
    Contains all interfaces need to provide defaults values of the chart options.
    org.pepstock.charba.client.defaults.chart
    Contains the default values of chart options based on type of chart instance.
    org.pepstock.charba.client.defaults.globals
    Contains the default values of chart options for all chart types (CHART.JS options defaults).
    org.pepstock.charba.client.enums
    Contains all enumerations of some chart options where only a specific set of values can be set.
    org.pepstock.charba.client.options
    Contains all elements to configure charts at global level (know as chart global options).

    • Uses of TimeUnit in org.pepstock.charba.client.adapters

      Methods in org.pepstock.charba.client.adapters with parameters of type TimeUnit 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Date DateAdapter.add​(long time, long amount, TimeUnit unit)
      Adds the specified amount of unit to the given timestamp.
      Date DateAdapter.add​(Date time, long amount, TimeUnit unit)
      Adds the specified amount of unit to the given date.
      double DateAdapter.diff​(long maxTime, long minTime, TimeUnit unit)
      Returns the number of unit between the given timestamps.
      double DateAdapter.diff​(Date maxTime, Date minTime, TimeUnit unit)
      Returns the number of unit between the given dates.
      Date DateAdapter.endOf​(long time, TimeUnit unit)
      Returns end of unit for the given timestamp.
      Date DateAdapter.endOf​(Date time, TimeUnit unit)
      Returns end of unit for the given date.
      String DateAdapter.format​(long time, TimeUnit unit)
      Returns the formatted date in the specified format for a given timestamp, using the default format related to time unit.
      String DateAdapter.format​(Date time, TimeUnit unit)
      Returns the formatted date in the specified format for a given date, using the default format related to time unit.
      String DateAdapterFormats.getFormat​(TimeUnit unit)
      Returns the format by TimeUnit provided by adapter.
      If not set, returns Constants.EMPTY_STRING.
      Date DateAdapter.startOf​(long time, TimeUnit unit)
      Returns the start of unit for the given timestamp.
      Date DateAdapter.startOf​(Date time, TimeUnit unit)
      Returns the start of unit for the given date.

    • Uses of TimeUnit in org.pepstock.charba.client.configuration

      Methods in org.pepstock.charba.client.configuration that return TimeUnit 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      TimeUnit Time.getMinUnit()
      The minimum display format to be used for a time unit.
      TimeUnit Time.getRound()
      If defined, dates will be rounded to the start of this unit.
      TimeUnit Time.getUnit()
      If defined, will force the unit to be a certain type.
      Methods in org.pepstock.charba.client.configuration with parameters of type TimeUnit 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      String DisplayFormats.getDisplayFormat​(TimeUnit unit)
      Returns the display formats are used to configure how different time units are formed in the strings for the axis tick marks.
      void DisplayFormats.setDisplayFormat​(TimeUnit unit, String format)
      Sets the display formats are used to configure how different time units are formed in the strings for the axis tick marks.
      void Time.setMinUnit​(TimeUnit unit)
      The minimum display format to be used for a time unit.
      void Time.setRound​(TimeUnit round)
      If defined, dates will be rounded to the start of this unit.
      void Time.setUnit​(TimeUnit unit)
      If defined, will force the unit to be a certain type.
